then and uh what the thing about Ukraine in the 1990s was that um the
infrastructure was falling apart the Soviet Union had just collapsed and nothing worked I remember you know the
the sewage uh the toilets wouldn't work the electricity would stop working we wouldn't have heating for for days and there weren't any products in the stores
so what you had to do to survive was you actually had to fix and build things yourself I remember me and my grandpa
we'd go and uh I had a toy gun and something broke we took it apart and he soldered it back together for me I
remember one time uh during the winter months they turned off all electricity and we had candles for a while but then
the candles ran out so um I started thinking you know why don't we use Christmas lights so my grandpa said why
not we we we got some 9vt batteries wired them up to the Christmas lights and it worked and we had light and those
early experiences in Ukraine kind of tinkering and building stuff that actually was applicable that helped us
survive dayto day um really really shaped my thinking going forward I I
learned that the environment you're in it it's malleable what wherever your place
no matter what the circumstances are you can change it you can alter where you are and what happens to you and the other thing I learned is that you don't
have to be an expert you know my my my grandpa he he was retired but uh he had before he had previously been uh an army
officer in the Soviet Army so so he had no experience with he just learned from scratch because there was a necessity
and the final thing that I learned was that even as as a child learning those
lessons helped shape my mindset going forward I saw everything as as something that I could change something that I
could tweak I would always ask questions you know why is this chair structured this way or why why is that system designed in that certain way can we
change it can we build it in a different way and so um when I was um 9 years old

came here the opportunities the resources here I I realized wow a friend

like um only like oligarchs had boats in Ukraine and here just an ordinary guy
